channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Guatemala says it suggested that U.S. send its unaccompanied migrant children home
item.description: As a U.S. federal judge blocked the deportation of unaccompanied Guatemalan children, the government of Guatemala says in a statement it suggested the U.S. return its children to their home country.
item.content:encoded:
As a U.S. federal judge blocked the deportation of unaccompanied Guatemalan children, the government of Guatemala says in a statement it suggested the U.S. return its children to their home country.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: Hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children can stay in the U.S. for now, judge says
item.description: A federal district judge issued a temporary restraining order after the U.S. attempted to deport hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children without proper immigration proceedings.
item.content:encoded:
A federal district judge issued a temporary restraining order after the U.S. attempted to deport hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children without proper immigration proceedings.

(Image credit: Johan Ordonez)
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: Friday night football brings healing in Kerrville
item.description: Still recovering from devastating July flash flooding, the Kerrville community gathered for the Texas tradition of high school football Friday night. As Texas Public Radio's David Martin Davies reports, the Tivy Antler varsity football team took on Del Rio in their season opener at Kerrville's Antler Stadium, the same location that was a volunteer hub after the July 4th flooding and where a recent massive memorial was held.
item.content:encoded: Still recovering from devastating July flash flooding, the Kerrville community gathered for the Texas tradition of high school football Friday night. As Texas Public Radio's David Martin Davies reports, the Tivy Antler varsity football team took on Del Rio in their season opener at Kerrville's Antler Stadium, the same location that was a volunteer hub after the July 4th flooding and where a recent massive memorial was held.
item.dc:creator: David Martin Davies

item.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized with broken vertebra after car accident, spokesperson says
item.description: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized with a broken vertebra after a car accident in New Hampshire, according to his spokesperson.
item.content:encoded:
Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized with a broken vertebra after a car accident in New Hampshire, according to his spokesperson.

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Chicago's mayor pushes back as Trump administration readies immigration crackdown
item.description: Brandon Johnson signed an executive order barring the city's police from collaborating with federal officers on civil immigration enforcement operations, and U.S. military personnel on police patrols.
item.content:encoded:
Brandon Johnson signed an executive order barring the city's police from collaborating with federal officers on civil immigration enforcement operations, and U.S. military personnel on police patrols.

(Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Iran-backed Houthis raid UN food and children's agencies in Yemen, detain employee
item.description: The Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations' food and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining at least one U.N. employee, officials said.
item.content:encoded:
The Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations' food and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining at least one U.N. employee, officials said.

(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How 3 Hawaiian teen princes brought surfing to the mainland
item.description: In 1885, royal Hawaiian brothers were studying at a military school in California. There, they introduced a sport known as "surfboard swimming." The Princes of Surf exhibit tells what happened next.
item.content:encoded:
In 1885, royal Hawaiian brothers were studying at a military school in California. There, they introduced a sport known as "surfboard swimming." The Princes of Surf exhibit tells what happened next.

(Image credit: Santa Cruz Museum of Art & History)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Don't let a selfie be the end of you
item.description: Selfies can be great fun — or horribly dangerous. India, which has tallied hundreds of injuries and deaths from risky selfie-taking, is urging folks to stay safe when holding up their phone for a pix.
item.content:encoded:
Selfies can be great fun — or horribly dangerous. India, which has tallied hundreds of injuries and deaths from risky selfie-taking, is urging folks to stay safe when holding up their phone for a pix.

(Image credit: Sajjad Hussain/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan

item.title: Can young Americans still have a better life than their parents? We want to know
item.description: For many Gen Z and millennial Americans, concerns about finances and the economy can feel ever present. NPR wants to know how economic barriers are affecting you and your political views.
item.content:encoded:
For many Gen Z and millennial Americans, concerns about finances and the economy can feel ever present. NPR wants to know how economic barriers are affecting you and your political views.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Trump administration cancels $679 million for offshore wind projects at ports
item.description: Ports across the country were planning to become economic hubs for the growing offshore wind industry. The Trump administration is cancelling grants to build the infrastructure for it.
item.content:encoded:
Ports across the country were planning to become economic hubs for the growing offshore wind industry. The Trump administration is cancelling grants to build the infrastructure for it.

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer
